task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Tesla Model 3\LOG\3F78A21D\00000001. Save the concatenated file as Tesla_Model_3_3F78A21D.mf4 in the same folder. GUI instructions: open the folder in the file dialog, click any file to focus the list, press CTRL+A to select all files, then press ENTER to load them.

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf window so subsequent queries/clicks target it
Get current desktop state to discover available UI elements (menus, buttons) before interacting
Open the Mode menu using coordinates discovered by the most recent State-Tool
Refresh UI state to find the 'Batch processing' menu item now that Mode is open
Switch application to Batch processing mode to enable batch operations (concatenate multiple files)
Discover Batch view UI elements (Add files button, operation controls) after switching mode
Open the file selection dialog to add multiple input .MF4 files for concatenation
Detect the file open dialog elements (File name edit, file list) so we can navigate to the target folder
Focus the File name / address input in the file dialog so we can type the target folder path
Enter the full folder path into the file dialog's File name/address field and press Enter to open that folder (use single backslashes as required)
Refresh the file dialog state to discover the listed .MF4 files in the target folder
Click any listed .MF4 file to focus the file list before selecting all files
Select all files in the focused file list (Ctrl+A) so every .MF4 in the folder will be added
Press Enter to confirm the selection and load all selected files into the Batch file list
Verify files are loaded into the Batch list and discover operation selection controls (Concatenate)
Select the 'Concatenate' batch operation so the files will be joined into one continuous measurement
Find the output filename input (or Save controls) in the Batch view so we can set the destination filename
Focus the output filename input field (or trigger the Save dialog field) to type the desired output filename
Enter the full output path and filename using single backslashes to save the concatenated result in the same folder with the specified name
Refresh UI to locate the final action button (Start or Save) after entering the output filename
Start the concatenation and save the resulting MF4 file by clicking the Save button
Confirm the application state after initiating save to ensure the concatenation process started or the file was created

Switch the app into Batch processing mode, open the Add files dialog, navigate to the specified folder, select all .MF4 files (click any file to focus, Ctrl+A, Enter to load), choose the Concatenate operation, provide the full output filename in the same folder, and click Save to produce the concatenated MF4. State-Tool calls before each interaction ensure UI elements are discovered dynamically and interactions target the correct controls.
